channel.title: Ruby on Marín Alcaraz
channel.description: Recent content in Ruby on Marín Alcaraz

item.title: Sieve of Eratosthenes
item.description: I had a bad experience with the Sieve of Eratosthenes during a college test, I became traumatized by it and tried to avoid it. During this holiday break I decided to face my fears (lol) and successfully implemented it ruby (not very idiomatic but ruby still) My favorite parts of this algorithm were: The fact that I don’t have to iterate the whole sieve! I can do it just for _sqrt(n) _since the factors of any number are always composed by two numbers and one of them is always lower than the sqrt of any given number n.
